item.title: Genesis Creditor Groups' Loans Amount to $1.8B and Counting: Sources
item.dc:creator: Ian Allison
item.description: In addition to the previously reported group of Gemini customers owed $900 million, there are two other groups of Genesis creditors being represented by lawyers, CoinDesk has learned.

media:content.media:description: Genesis logo (Genesis Trading, Modified by CoinDesk)

item.title: A European Central Bank Blog Decries the End of Bitcoin, and We Aren’t Buying It
item.dc:creator: George Kaloudis
item.description: Plus: What happens when you go from bitcoin-only to … not? Crypto Long & Short is CoinDesk's weekly newsletter featuring insights, news and analysis for the professional investor.

media:content.media:description: Another day, another bitcoin doomsayer (DALL-E, CoinDesk)

item.title: Crypto Markets Today: Galaxy Digital Expands Brokerage Services With GK8 Acquisition
item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Yang
item.description: The cryptocurrency-focused financial services firm won an auction to buy the company from crypto lender Celsius, which filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection. Crypto Markets Today is CoinDesk’s daily newsletter diving into what happened in today's crypto markets.

media:content.media:description: Galaxy Digital won an auction to buy self-custody platform GK8. (Jeremy Thomas/Unsplash)

item.title: Crypto Derivatives DEXs Reposition for Life After FTX
item.dc:creator: Danny Nelson
item.description: Decentralized exchanges are retooling their public-facing approach.

media:content.media:description: Hxro founder Dan Gunsberg speaking at Solana Breakpoint 2022 (Danny Nelson/CoinDesk)

item.title: Three Arrows Capital Liquidators Seize $35.6M From Singaporean Banks
item.dc:creator: Cheyenne Ligon
item.description: Liquidators for Three Arrows Capital (3AC) have seized $35.6 million from the collapsed crypto hedge fund’s bank accounts in Singapore three months after getting the nod from that country’s High Court to begin probing 3ACs assets in the country.

media:content.media:description: Three Arrows Capital's liquidator has seized $35.6 million from Singaporean banks (The Image Bank/Getty Images)

item.dc:creator: Nick Baker

item.title: Crypto Is at ‘Brick Wall Stage' and Needs ‘Right Balance’ of Regulation, Says Legal Expert
item.dc:creator: Fran Velasquez
item.description: Pennsylvania State University Dickinson Law Professor Tonya Evans discusses why the ecosystem is in need of thoughtful regulation from lawmakers on Capitol Hill.

media:content.media:description: Professor Tonya M. Evans (MD Photography)

item.title: S. Korean Judge Dismisses Arrest Warrant for Terra Co-Founder Shin
item.dc:creator: Nelson Wang
item.description: An arrest warrant for Do Kwon, another co-founder, remains in effect, however.

media:content.media:description: Terra co-founders Daniel Shin and Do Kwon (Terraform Labs)

item.title: Brands Will Save Crypto? Be Careful What You Wish For
item.dc:creator: Michael J. Casey
item.description: It’s not enough to depend on the goodwill of legacy platforms and of the mega-companies that use core blockchain frameworks to reach audiences and customers. We must deliberately build systems over which those corporate machines can’t exert control.

media:content.media:description: (Rachel Sun/CoinDesk)

item.title: Bitcoin Miners’ FTX Contagion Exposure May Amplify Industry Pain
item.dc:creator: Eliza Gkritsi
item.description: Core Scientific, Bitfarms and Genesis Digital Assets are among miners that have direct and indirect exposure to the contagion.

media:content.media:description: AI Artwork collapse falling down crumbling (DALL-E/CoinDesk)

item.title: Alameda Research Shouldered FTX Loss of Up to $1B Following Client's Leveraged Trade in 2021: FT
item.dc:creator: Jamie Crawley
item.description: Alameda Research bore the brunt of a $1 billion loss incurred by its sister firm FTX after a leveraged trade on the now bankrupt crypto exchange backfired early last year, the Financial Times reported Friday.

media:content.media:description: Former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried (Jesse Hamilton/CoinDesk)

item.title: Facebook Parent Meta Dips Toe Back Into Policy Circles to Boost Metaverse
item.dc:creator: Jesse Hamilton
item.description: After Meta Platforms (META) famously riled up U.S. regulators with Facebook’s abortive stablecoin initiative, the company is back with an effort to influence digital policy – this time for the metaverse – but it’s charting a less aggressive course.

media:content.media:description: Meta Platforms CEO Mark Zuckerberg (Mandel Ngan-Pool/Getty Images)

item.title: Galaxy Digital Wins Auction to Buy GK8 From Bankrupt Crypto Lender Celsius
item.dc:creator: Parikshit Mishra, Jamie Crawley
item.description: GK8, the self-custody platform bought by Celsius Network over a year ago, was put on the block following Celsius's bankruptcy.

media:content.media:description: Michael Novogratz's Galaxy Digital is buying custody platform GK8 from Celsius Network. (Sam Reynolds/CoinDesk)

item.description: A delay in updating price data on BNB-related derivative tokens allowed some exploiters to piggyback off a previous attack.

item.description: FTX has approved its Japanese subsidiary's plan to restart withdrawals for customers.

item.title: Avalanche-Based DEX Trader Joe to Soon Deploy on Ethereum Scaling System Arbitrum
item.dc:creator: Shaurya Malwa
item.description: Trader Joe locks up over $95 million worth of tokens as of Friday and is among the most popular Avalanche-based products.

item.title: Crypto Exchange Zipmex Secures Creditor Protection Extension as Takeover Deal Nears
item.dc:creator: Oliver Knight
item.description: Zipmex, the South Asian exchange that froze withdrawals due to a shortfall in liquidity earlier this year, has secured creditor protection for all of its entities until April next year, according to an update on the company's website.

media:content.media:description: (Michal Jarmoluk/Pixabay)

item.title: Dogecoin's Bitcoin-Beating Bounce May Be Bad News for the Market
item.dc:creator: Omkar Godbole
item.description: Dogecoin has trounced bitcoin with a 40% surge in the past 10 days. In the past, outsized gains in DOGE have paved the way for a broader market sell-off.

media:content.media:description: Dogecoin, a meme based on the shiba inu dog breed, was started as a joke in 2013. (Christal Yuen/Unsplash)

item.title: DeFi Protocol Ankr to Reimburse Users Affected by $5M Exploit
item.dc:creator: Sam Reynolds
item.description: The attacker was able to mint 6 quadrillion aBNBc tokens, which they eventually turned into around 5 million USDC.

media:content.media:description: (Shutterstock)

item.title: First Mover Asia: Cryptos' Short Win Streak Ends as Investors Remain Cautious
item.dc:creator: Shaurya Malwa, James Rubin
item.description: ALSO: Shaurya Malwa writes that oversubscription of an initial exchange offering at Binance underscores investors continued interest in crypto and may offer hope for the industry's rebound.

item.title: Crypto Markets Today: CFTC Chair Proposes Pause to Overhaul Digital Commodities Consumer Protection Bill
item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Yang
item.description: Rostin Behnam made the suggestion as regulators and the crypto industry continue processing the implosion of crypto exchange giant FTX. Crypto Markets Today is CoinDesk’s daily newsletter diving into what happened in today's crypto markets.

media:content.media:description: CFTC Chair Rostin Behnam (Nikhilesh De/CoinDesk)

item.title: US CFTC Commissioner Cites Latest Crypto Sanction in Call for New Rules
item.dc:creator: Jesse Hamilton
item.description: CFTC Commissioner Kristin Johnson is pushing for her agency to work on policies to further tighten custody of customer assets as the CFTC sanctions another crypto Ponzi scheme.

media:content.media:description: CFTC Commissioner Kristin N. Johnson and Conrad Bahlke, counsel at Willkie Farr & Gallagher LL at Crypto Connection 2022 (Amitoj Singh/CoinDesk)

item.title: Stripe Debuts Fiat-to-Crypto Payment Offering for Web3 Businesses
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Napolitano
item.description: The widget allows customers to more easily use crypto to engage with businesses and content creators across the world.

media:content.media:description: John Collison, co-founder and president of Stripe (Christophe Morin/IP3/Getty Images)

item.title: November Jobs Report Due Friday as the Fed's Powell Confirms Slower Pace of Rate Hikes
item.dc:creator: Helene Braun
item.description: Friday’s employment report for November is expected to show a sizable slowdown in hiring, but the labor market remains too tight, according to Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell.

media:content.media:description: Friday's employment report is expected to show the slowest pace of new jobs in two years. (Getty images)

item.title: CFTC Chairman Suggests 'Pause' to Overhaul Senate Bill Following FTX Debacle
item.dc:creator: Nikhilesh De
item.description: Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) Chairman Rostin Behnam said that while new legislation allowing his agency greater spot market oversight over crypto should move swiftly, lawmakers should also ensure there are no "gaps."

media:content.media:description: CFTC Chairman Rostin Behnam testifying on FTX before the Senate Agriculture Committee. (Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images)

item.title: Magic Eden Launches Protocol to Enforce Creator Royalties
item.dc:creator: Rosie Perper
item.description: The top marketplace for Solana NFTs moved to an optional creator royalty model last month.

item.title: Coinbase Disables Mobile NFT Transfers, Citing Apple’s App Store Policies
item.dc:creator: Eli Tan
item.description: The exchange made the announcement in a Thursday Twitter thread, saying Apple is demanding Coinbase pay a 30% tax on gas fees used to transfer all NFTs.

item.title: FTX Collapse Highlights Need for Global Crypto Regulations, Says US Treasury’s Adeyemo: Reuters
item.dc:creator: Nelson Wang
item.description: Deputy Treasury Secretary Wally Adeyemo said such regulations were important to ensure the protection of investors, consumers and financial stability.

media:content.media:description: Wally Adeyemo, deputy secretary of the U.S. Treasury Department (Suzanne Cordiero/CoinDesk)

item.title: Crypto Industry a Disaster in Need of Rebranding, UK Lawmaker Says
item.dc:creator: Camomile Shumba
item.description: The lawmaker begs the industry to leave the "bad boats" to burn out at sea and ditch the word "crypto" following FTX collapse.

media:content.media:description: (TerryHealy/Getty Images)

item.title: MakerDAO Community Votes to Hike DAI Rewards to 1%
item.dc:creator: Krisztian Sandor
item.description: Some 71% of voters favored hiking the DAI Savings Rate to 1%, the highest option offered in the voting.

item.title: Solana-Based DEX Orca Partners With Stripe for Fiat Transactions
item.dc:creator: Jamie Crawley
item.description: Orca, a Solana-based decentralized exchange (DEX), has integrated with payments heavyweight Stripe to to power its fiat-to-crypto transactions.

item.title: NYDFS Proposes Regulation Allowing It to Charge Crypto Companies in New York for Supervision Costs
item.dc:creator: Cheyenne Ligon
item.description: The New York Department of Financial Services (NYDFS) published a proposed regulation on Thursday that lays out how the state regulator would assess New York-regulated crypto companies for costs associated with their supervision.

media:content.media:description: NYDFS Superintendent Adrienne Harris speaking with Chainalysis co-founder Jonathan Levin at Links 2022. (Cheyenne Ligon/CoinDesk)

item.title: Compass Mining Launches Bitcoin Miner Protection Plan
item.dc:creator: Eliza Gkritsi
item.description: The plan is initially available to customers hosted in Texas, South Carolina, Nebraska and Oklahoma.

media:content.media:description: Compass Mining's booth at Mining Disrupt in Miami in July 2022. (Eliza Gkritsi/CoinDesk)

item.description: A deal to buy Digivault, which is winding down operations, would include a crypto license in the United Kingdom.

item.title: Polygon APIs to Soon Deploy on Web3 Indexing Service The Graph
item.dc:creator: Shaurya Malwa
item.description: The Graph is a decentralized protocol for indexing and querying data from blockchains, starting with Ethereum. It makes it possible to query data that is difficult to query directly.

media:content.media:description: Polygon APIs will soon be available on The Graph. (Aquaryus15/Unsplash)

item.title: Web3 Content-Delivery Network Fleek Raises $25M
item.dc:creator: Brandy Betz
item.description: Crypto-focused venture capital firm Polychain Capital led the round.

media:content.media:description: Fleek raises $25 million for its Web3 content-delivery network (Pixabay)

item.title: Bernstein: Crypto User Activity Is Moving On-Chain Following FTX's Collapse
item.dc:creator: Will Canny
item.description: The Arbitrum and Optimism blockchains are seeing the strongest momentum in terms of user trends, the report said.

media:content.media:description: Crypto users are leaving centralized exchanges and moving to on-chain transactions. (Tom Barrett/Unsplash)

item.title: Bitcoin's Price Action Is Encouraging, But It May Not Signal Bottom: Traders
item.dc:creator: Omkar Godbole
item.description: Bitcoin's price needs to trade above its 21-week moving average to confirm a bottom, one trader said.

media:content.media:description: It may be too soon to go bottom fishing with bitcoin, some traders say. (Robson Hatsukami Morgan, Unsplash)

item.title: Canada's Manitoba Province Enacts 18-Month Moratorium on New Crypto Mining
item.dc:creator: Eliza Gkritsi
item.description: The local heavily indebted utility has received up to 4.6 GW of requests from miners looking to connect to the grid.

media:content.media:description: A panoramic view of Winnipeg in Manitoba, Canada. (Bob Linsdell/Wikimedia Commons)
